update.description:
Fix for drift issue #680.   With this patch, [drcsim pull request #309](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/drcsim/pull-request/309/remove-auto-disable-for-atlas/diff).

Update to improve physics solution by

1.  Warm starting bi-lateral constraints.
1.  Reordering so bilateral contacts are solved first, followed by contact normal forces, and lastly frictional forces at contacts.
1.  Further decrease successive over-relaxation for frictional directions to 0.25x those of normal directions.

First one improves overall physics solution by starting with `labmda` from previous simulation step, 2) and 3) removes the rotational drift and reduces linear drift significantly.
update.title: improve physics solution (issue #680)

content.raw:
As I said before, this pull request reduces drift for Atlas's feet and the drc vehicle. In my testing with Atlas walking, driving the drc_vehicle, and grasping the firehose, it appears to improve physics performance and reduce velocity noise with no performance cost.

The evidence against is that it causes the SimplePendulum test to fail, though it fails in a section related to adjusting physics engine parameters ([see physics.cc:1421](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/18c3d8d77294/test/regression/physics.cc#cl-1421)). On the other hand, the SimplePendulum test involves a model with an ill-conditioned mass matrix, as well as simulation parameters that differ from those used in the VRC simulator.

The pluses outweigh the strange behavior of the SimplePendulum test for me.
content.html:
As I said before, this pull request reduces drift for Atlas's feet and the drc vehicle. In my testing with Atlas walking, driving the drc_vehicle, and grasping the firehose, it appears to improve physics performance and reduce velocity noise with no performance cost.

The evidence against is that it causes the SimplePendulum test to fail, though it fails in a section related to adjusting physics engine parameters (see physics.cc:1421). On the other hand, the SimplePendulum test involves a model with an ill-conditioned mass matrix, as well as simulation parameters that differ from those used in the VRC simulator.

The pluses outweigh the strange behavior of the SimplePendulum test for me.

content.raw: the failing SimplePendulum test is fixed by commenting out [this line](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/d5a3a4c7607cb326b454fda612764aff1688c35c/test/regression/physics.cc?at=warm_start#cl-1416)
content.html: the failing SimplePendulum test is fixed by commenting out this line

content.raw: just made a change for `JointDampingTest`, changing checks from `EXPECT_LT` and `EXPECT_GT` to `EXPECT_NEAR` with `PHYSICS_TOL`.
content.html: just made a change for JointDampingTest, changing checks from EXPECT_LT and EXPECT_GT to EXPECT_NEAR with PHYSICS_TOL.

content.raw: I get a compiler warning saying this variable isn't used.
content.html: I get a compiler warning saying this variable isn't used.

content.raw: One of the physics test failures is off by epsilon, and the other appears to be a problem with the Reset World action.
content.html: One of the physics test failures is off by epsilon, and the other appears to be a problem with the Reset World action.

content.raw: I also saw a few gcc warnings. I'll need to re-build to remember where they were.
content.html: I also saw a few gcc warnings. I'll need to re-build to remember where they were.

content.raw: This reduces drift of the polaris vehicle, and also improves the contact force stability in the test/worlds/contact_stability.world. It causes some physics tests to fail, which we are currently investigating.
content.html: This reduces drift of the polaris vehicle, and also improves the contact force stability in the test/worlds/contact_stability.world. It causes some physics tests to fail, which we are currently investigating.
